January 20, 195S
Dr. Raymond D. Cheydleur
Assistant Director
Radio Station WFSU
Florida State University
Tallahassee, Florida
Dear Ray;
Have been going through the research files and corres¬
pondence this weekend. This is a gloomy Sunday afternoon
in Iowa — probably too depressing a day to be writing drafts
of letters — but my only chance to catch tip on this sort
of thing.
1 found a number of references to your bringing your
summary of theses on radio-television up-to-date. Wonderful
idea. Was this done? If not, is it still in the works some¬
place? X also found references to the fact that a research
manual (I gather the same idea that X suggested in Chicago and
for which X have started a part on coincidentals) was being
worked on as far back as 1954. What ever happened to this?
Do we have any parts of it? Xf so, we could utilize them in
our new manual. Xf it was done, we can simply save that time
it would take to do it again.
X have asked Paulu to request funds for a committee
meeting, following the completion of our Columbus report,
for the final drafting of our research proposals for presen¬
tation to a foundation. X thought that the same amount of
money which was available for our Chicago meeting would be
adequate for this purpose. X think we will need to do most
of this work by correspondence and each individual getting as
many of his ideas on paper beforehand as possible, but a meeting
will be needed to try to hammer out some final consensus.
On the implementation report from Gale, X do not think
we need to send corrections to Keith at this point. He, as
X understand it, will send everyone a copy of everything for
corrections as soon as he has it all pulled together. X do
